fields.Brief description of the provider: Deutsche Telekom's TechBoost is a startup accelerator program supporting technology startups in Germany with infrastructure, sales, and network opportunities.
fields.What you get: Up to €100,000 in free Open Telekom Cloud credits, exclusive discounts on Telekom products and services, comprehensive sales and marketing support, access to a large customer network, and invitations to partner events and workshops.
fields.How to get it: Startups with digital business models can apply through the TechBoost website (techboost.telekom.com/public/apply) and, if selected, join the program for up to one year.

fields.Brief description of the provider: UnternehmerTUM is a leading European center for innovation and business creation, closely connected to the Technical University of Munich, supporting startups, founders, investors, and corporates through incubation, acceleration, and networking programs.
fields.What you get: Access to extensive incubation and acceleration programs (XPRENEURS, TechFounders, TUM Venture Labs), coaching, mentoring, collaboration opportunities, investment connections, and the chance to pitch at high-profile demo events like The Reveal and TUM Entrepreneurship Day.
fields.How to get it: Apply to relevant programs (XPRENEURS, TechFounders, TUM Venture Labs) via their official websites; event participation is often open via free registration, and certain programs have wildcard or open spots for new applicants.

fields.Brief description of the provider: XPRENEURS is a high-tech startup incubator by UnternehmerTUM in Munich, supporting early-stage and pre-seed startups with a strong technology focus.
fields.What you get: A 3-month, full-time, equity-free accelerator program featuring intensive business model validation, mentorship from 250+ experts, access to investors and corporates, tailored workshops, and potential prototyping grants of up to €5,000.
fields.How to get it: Apply during the open application phase (next: June 4–July 7, 2025) and, if accepted, participate in the upcoming batch; early-stage, high-tech European startups are the target.

fields.Brief description of the provider: IONOS is a German-based digital solutions and cloud hosting provider offering infrastructure, website, and AI services to businesses of all sizes.
fields.What you get: Eligible startups can participate in the IONOS Startup Program, gaining access to mentorship, networking opportunities, and potentially infrastructure or cloud service benefits. IONOS also offers a sovereign AI platform with open source models hosted in German data centers.
fields.How to get it: Startups can apply through the IONOS Startup Program webpage; details and eligibility requirements are available in their Startup Program FAQ.

fields.Brief description of the provider: Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers cloud computing infrastructure and services for startups to build, scale, and manage their products efficiently.
fields.What you get: Eligible startups can receive up to $100,000 in AWS Activate credits, which are applied to offset AWS cloud usage costs, plus access to technical support, business guidance, and exclusive resources.
fields.How to get it: Startups must apply via the AWS Activate Console; affiliation with an approved AWS Activate Provider (such as accelerator, incubator, or public program) is required for the top tier, while self-apply for up to $1,000 Founders credits is also possible if not linked to a provider. German accelerators like XPRENEURS, XPLORE, TechFounders, TUM Venture Labs, or UVC can nominate startups, granting larger credit packages upon approval.

fields.Brief description of the provider: Make.com is an automation platform that allows users to design, build, and automate workflows connecting apps and services without coding.
fields.What you get: Three months of the Core plan for free.
fields.How to get it: Sign up through the provided link, selecting your region and country, and create an account.

fields.Name: IBM Startup Program
fields.What you get: €3,000 in IBM Cloud credits per month for six months.
fields.Internal Notes: IBM seems to have killed their startup program. Super dissapointing!

fields.Brief description of the provider: DigitalOcean is a global cloud infrastructure provider offering scalable solutions and special programs for startups to accelerate their growth.
fields.What you get: Eligible startups can receive up to $100,000 in compute credits, up to 3 months of free GPU usage, complimentary premium support, go-to-market acceleration, access to a marketplace of over 638,000 customers, co-marketing opportunities, and exclusive partner perks like Stripe and Cloudflare offers.
fields.How to get it: Startups must apply to the DigitalOcean Hatch program; eligibility, including for German startups from ecosystems like XPRENEURS, XPLORE, TechFounders, TUM Venture Labs, or UVC, typically requires validation via a program partner or through DigitalOcean’s application portal.
